newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Kazakhstan bans numbered bank accounts.
newsitem.headline: Kazakhstan bans numbered bank accounts.

text.p: Kazakhstan's parliament has banned the use of anonymous numbered bank accounts, which had been permitted by presidential decree from February 1994, and which could have provided many loopholes for tax-evaders.
"Not a single account of this type had been opened since the issue of the decree," Marat Ospanov, Chairman of the Mazhilis lower house of the parlaiment, said on Thursday.
"Besides anonymous accounts could have given an opportunity to avoid taxes to residents of other states with which we have double taxation agreements," he said.
A treaty of this kind between Kazakhstan and the United States is being ratified by the U.S. Senate, and this has accelerated the abolition of the decree, Ospanov said.

The National Bank had previously called for the right to anonymous accounts to be abolished, as this would bring direct economic avantages, given the prospect of serious investment in the economy from the U.S. and other countries.
